intro: Gamochaeta irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazu panicled grass, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its inflorescence consists of a dense array of small, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Gamochaeta irazuensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
